$interpreted: Ace: ...This certainly is Angelia's handwriting and wax seal. I see, thank you for your assistance.
Ace: There's no time to lose. We'll make preparations to leave at once.
Diana: Then we shall leave you to it. If the Desert Kingdom can be of any further help, please let me know.
Ace: Okay, you have our gratitude.
Izumi: They didn't hesitate for one moment~ Do the Kingdom of the Sun really have such lax memories?
Nigel: ...Don't beat around the bush. Speak, if you've got something to say.
Izumi: Oh, nothing. I'm just making small talk~
Nigel: (I know exactly what you meant. Even if the war's over now, the Kingdom of the Sun are still Atlas' mortal enemies...)
Nigel: ...Hey!
Elio: I-it's been a while, Mr. Nigel...
Nigel: Are you looking to borrow Atlas' underground library?
Elio: Yes. I'll need to uncover more lost knowledge if I'm to be of any help to the East.
Nigel: First you betray Angelia, now you're back on her side. And what about next time? Will you stand with Theodore again?
Elio: I...
Nigel: Hmph, you Carloses are all the same.
Elio: ……
Ace: If I remember right, it was you who won over Angelia, but then left the Kingdom of the Sun to burn. And now you're working together with Her Highness once again.
Ace: When it comes to betrayal, you've got to be the supreme authority.
Nigel: Working together? You make it sound almost respectable. Using each other, more like!
Nigel: I know exactly what your Queen is up to. Talk down Theodore all you want, but let's be honest, you see the demihumans as just as much a threat.
Elio: That's not it, Mr. Nigel...
Ace: Oh, so you think the demihumans are all harmless and innocent? Some leader you are.
Nigel: You can talk! Your noble hands are covered in demihuman blood!
Ace: So what? If I apologized, would you even accept it?
Nigel: Certainly not! What do you take me for!
Ace: So why get yourself mixed up in all this in the first place?
Nigel: You...!
Ace: One's interests and benefits are the essence of politics. Mutual benefit, mutual betrayal. And then mutual benefit, once more.
Nigel: The demihumans aren't as cold or calculating as the likes of you! All I want is an end to our persecution!
Ace: And how will you achieve that? By holding a grudge against the Kingdom of the Sun and making monster chow of yourself out here?
Nigel: I...
Ace: You can go on playing house if you don't want to make real decisions. Her Highness does what she does for her people... and you are nothing next to her.
Elio: ...Mr. Nigel, I know how you feel, but if these monsters keep coming, the demihumans will be doomed, too.
Elio: ...I don't know about politics, but I'm certain that if we don't work together to seal the void, then sooner or later...
Elio: ...there won't be any of us left.
Nigel: ......
Elio: The most important thing for the demihumans right now is to protect Atlas from misfortune, right?
Nigel: (...We can't beat the monsters without working together, it's true... but how can I trust the humans again...)
Izumi: Hmm...

Model.Text: ...This certainly is Angelia's handwriting and wax seal. I see, thank you for your assistance.
There's no time to lose. We'll make preparations to leave at once.
Then we shall leave you to it. If the Desert Kingdom can be of any further help, please let me know.
Okay, you have our gratitude.
They didn't hesitate for one moment~ Do the Kingdom of the Sun really have such lax memories?
...Don't beat around the bush. Speak, if you've got something to say.
Oh, nothing. I'm just making small talk~
(I know exactly what you meant. Even if the war's over now, the Kingdom of the Sun are still Atlas' mortal enemies...)
...Hey!
I-it's been a while, Mr. Nigel...
Are you looking to borrow Atlas' underground library?
Yes. I'll need to uncover more lost knowledge if I'm to be of any help to the East.
First you betray Angelia, now you're back on her side. And what about next time? Will you stand with Theodore again?
Hmph, you Carloses are all the same.
If I remember right, it was you who won over Angelia, but then left the Kingdom of the Sun to burn. And now you're working together with Her Highness once again.
When it comes to betrayal, you've got to be the supreme authority.
Working together? You make it sound almost respectable. Using each other, more like!
I know exactly what your Queen is up to. Talk down Theodore all you want, but let's be honest, you see the demihumans as just as much a threat.
That's not it, Mr. Nigel...
Oh, so you think the demihumans are all harmless and innocent? Some leader you are.
You can talk! Your noble hands are covered in demihuman blood!
So what? If I apologized, would you even accept it?
Certainly not! What do you take me for!
So why get yourself mixed up in all this in the first place?
You...!
One's interests and benefits are the essence of politics. Mutual benefit, mutual betrayal. And then mutual benefit, once more.
The demihumans aren't as cold or calculating as the likes of you! All I want is an end to our persecution!
And how will you achieve that? By holding a grudge against the Kingdom of the Sun and making monster chow of yourself out here?
You can go on playing house if you don't want to make real decisions. Her Highness does what she does for her people... and you are nothing next to her.
...Mr. Nigel, I know how you feel, but if these monsters keep coming, the demihumans will be doomed, too.
...I don't know about politics, but I'm certain that if we don't work together to seal the void, then sooner or later...
...there won't be any of us left.
The most important thing for the demihumans right now is to protect Atlas from misfortune, right?
(...We can't beat the monsters without working together, it's true... but how can I trust the humans again...)
Hmm...
